00024 #ifndef _NIF_FILE_H_
00025 #define _NIF_FILE_H_
00026 
00027 #include <libs/mangle/stream/stream.hpp>
00028 #include <libs/mangle/stream/filters/buffer_stream.hpp>
00029 #include <components/misc/slice_array.hpp>
00030 
00031 #include <stdexcept>
00032 #include <vector>
00033 #include <string>
00034 #include <assert.h>
00035 
00036 #include "record.hpp"
00037 #include "nif_types.hpp"
00038 
00039 using namespace Mangle::Stream;
00040 
00041 namespace Nif
00042 {
00043 
00044 class NIFFile
00045 {
00046   enum NIFVersion
00047     {
00048       VER_MW    = 0x04000002    // Morrowind NIFs
00049     };
00050 
00052   int ver;
00053 
00055   StreamPtr inp;
00056 
00058   std::string filename;
00059 
00061   std::vector<Record*> records;
00062 
00064   void parse();
00065 
00066  public:
00068   void fail(const std::string &msg)
00069     {
00070       std::string err = "NIFFile Error: " + msg;
00071       err += "\nFile: " + filename;
00072       throw std::runtime_error(err);
00073     }
00074 
00076   NIFFile(StreamPtr nif, const std::string &name)
00077     : filename(name)
00078     {
00079       /* Load the entire file into memory. This allows us to use
00080          direct pointers to the data arrays in the NIF, instead of
00081          individually allocating and copying each one.
00082 
00083          The NIF data is only stored temporarily in memory, since once
00084          the mesh data is loaded it is siphoned into OGRE and
00085          deleted. For that reason, we might improve this further and
00086          use a shared region/pool based allocation scheme in the
00087          future, especially since only one NIFFile will ever be loaded
00088          at any given time.
00089       */
00090       inp = StreamPtr(new BufferStream(nif));
00091 
00092       parse();
00093     }
00094 
00095   ~NIFFile()
00096     {
00097       for(std::size_t i=0; i<records.size(); i++)
00098         {
00099           delete records[i];
00100         }
00101     }
00102 
00104   Record *getRecord(int index)
00105   {
00106     assert(index >= 0 && index < static_cast<int> (records.size()));
00107     Record *res = records[index];
00108     assert(res != NULL);
00109     return res;
00110   }
00111 
00113   int numRecords() { return records.size(); }
00114 
00115   /* ************************************************
00116 
00117                Parser functions
00118 
00119   ****************************************************/
00120 
00121   void skip(size_t size) { inp->getPtr(size); }
00122 
00123   template<class X> const X* getPtr() { return (const X*)inp->getPtr(sizeof(X)); }
00124   template<class X> X getType() { return *getPtr<X>(); }
00125   unsigned short getShort() { return getType<unsigned short>(); }
00126   int getInt() { return getType<int>(); }
00127   float getFloat() { return getType<float>(); }
00128   char getByte() { return getType<char>(); }
00129 
00130   template<class X>
00131   Misc::SliceArray<X> getArrayLen(int num)
00132     { return Misc::SliceArray<X>((const X*)inp->getPtr(num*sizeof(X)),num); }
00133 
00134   template<class X>
00135   Misc::SliceArray<X> getArray()
00136     {
00137       int len = getInt();
00138       return getArrayLen<X>(len);
00139     }
00140 
00141   Misc::SString getString() { return getArray<char>(); }
00142 
00143   const Vector *getVector() { return getPtr<Vector>(); }
00144   const Matrix *getMatrix() { return getPtr<Matrix>(); }
00145   const Transformation *getTrafo() { return getPtr<Transformation>(); }
00146   const Vector4 *getVector4() { return getPtr<Vector4>(); }
00147 
00148   Misc::FloatArray getFloatLen(int num)
00149     { return getArrayLen<float>(num); }
00150 
00151   // For fixed-size strings where you already know the size
00152   const char *getString(int size)
00153     { return (const char*)inp->getPtr(size); }
00154 };
00155 
00156 } // Namespace
00157 #endif
